Screen.title: TopScreen
Screen.Label: ---------- Mouse Button 1 click on field to change ----------

Help.Tip: Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
Help.Text:
dabra - PROCESSDEFAULTS
Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
 
 Default = SYSTEM
 Allowed = SYSTEM
 Allowed = PROJECT
 Allowed = USER
 SYSTEM defaults are the defaults listed in the CPS documentation.
 
 PROJECT defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as Project
 Default button.
 
 USER defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as User Default
 button.

Screen.title: Input and Output
Screen.Label: analyse Dip and ABRA horizon slices
NUMTR =
Number of input and output data volumes.
NDPT =
Number of horizons on input and output traces.
HDR_IDENT =
Header word containing trace identification.
HORIZON_UNIT=
Whether horizons are in time or depth.
EDIT_BETA =
BETA attribute horizons.
NEED_BETA =
ID_BETA =
EDIT_XDIP =
XDIP attribute horizons.
NEED_XDIP =
ID_XDIP =
EDIT_YDIP =
YDIP attribute horizons.
NEED_YDIP =
ID_YDIP =
EDIT_VAV =
Average velocity horizons.
NEED_VAV =
ID_VAV =
Weight horizons.
NEED_WEIGHT =
ID_WEIGHT =
Horizon time/depths.
NEED_DEPTH =
ID_DEPTH =
Data Volume:
HDR_X =
HDR_Y =
Header words containing X and Y coordinates.
X_INIT =
Y_INIT =
First X and Y bin center.
X_INC =
Y_INC =
X and Y bin increment.
X_LAST =
Y_LAST =
Last X and Y bin center.
X_TOT =
Y_TOT =
Number of X and Y bins.
MBYTES =
Number of megabytes of permanent memory required.

Help.Tip: Number of input and output data volumes to slice.
Help.Text:
dabra - NUMTR
Number of input and output data volumes to slice.

Help.Tip: Number of horizons on input and output traces.
Help.Text:
dabra - NDPT
Number of horizons on input and output traces.

Help.Tip: Header word containing trace identification.
Help.Text:
dabra - HDR_IDENT
Header word containing trace identification.
 
 Default = 48
 Allowed = 1-NWIH   (normally 48-55 or 65-NWIH)
 
 The following identification integers must reside in the specified
 header word of each trace:
 
     91  The weights                                      (calculated by KA).
     85  The output average velocity                          (edited by KA).
    181  The residual NMO velocity ratio       (BETA attribute edited by KA).
    188  The structural dip in the X direction (XDIP attribute edited by KA).
    189  The structural dip in the Y direction (YDIP attribute edited by KA).
      1  The time or depth of the horizon.

Help.Tip: Whether horizons are in time or depth.
Help.Text:
dabra - HORIZON_UNIT
Whether horizons are in time or depth.
 
 Default = depth
 Allowed = time or depth
 
 This parameter is needed only when calculating interval velocities from
 the average velocity horizons.  The algorithm is different depending on
 whether the time/depth trace contains horizon times or horizon depths.
 
 This parameter is used only when applying interval velocity constraints
 to the BETA attribute.

Help.Tip: Whether to edit the BETA attribute horizons.
Help.Text:
dabra - EDIT_BETA
Whether to edit the BETA attribute horizons.
 
 Default = YES
 Allowed = YES or NO
 
 The output BETA attribute horizons will be the edited and smoothed versions
 of the input BETA attribute horizons.
 
 BETA = (input average velocity / output average velocity)**2 - 1
 
 sqrt(BETA + 1) = input average velocity / output average velocity.
 
 The output edited BETA attribute horizons might contain nil values unless
 REPLACE_NILS_AFTER and REPLACE_NILS_AFTER_CONSTRAINTS say to replace nil
 values.

Help.Tip: Whether the BETA attribute horizons are required input.
Help.Text:
dabra - NEED_BETA
Whether the BETA attribute horizons are required input.

Help.Tip: Identification in HDR_IDENT for the BETA attribute horizons.
Help.Text:
dabra - ID_BETA
Identification in HDR_IDENT for the BETA attribute horizons.

Help.Tip: Whether to edit the XDIP attribute horizons.
Help.Text:
dabra - EDIT_XDIP
Whether to edit the XDIP attribute horizons.
 
 Default = YES
 Allowed = YES or NO
 
 The output XDIP attribute horizons will be the edited and smoothed versions
 of the input XDIP attribute volume.
 
 The output edited XDIP attribute horizons might contain nil values unless
 REPLACE_NILS_AFTER says to replace nil values.

Help.Tip: Whether the XDIP attribute horizons are required input.
Help.Text:
dabra - NEED_XDIP
Whether the XDIP attribute horizons are required input.

Help.Tip: Identification in HDR_IDENT for the XDIP attribute horizons.
Help.Text:
dabra - ID_XDIP
Identification in HDR_IDENT for the XDIP attribute horizons.

Help.Tip: Whether to edit the YDIP attribute horizons.
Help.Text:
dabra - EDIT_YDIP
Whether to edit the YDIP attribute horizons.
 
 Default = YES
 Allowed = YES or NO
 
 The output YDIP attribute horizons will be the edited and smoothed versions
 of the input YDIP attribute horizons.
 
 The output edited YDIP attribute horizons might contain nil values unless
 REPLACE_NILS_AFTER says to replace nil values.

Help.Tip: Whether the YDIP attribute horizons are required input.
Help.Text:
dabra - NEED_YDIP
Whether the YDIP attribute horizons are required input.

Help.Tip: Identification in HDR_IDENT for the YDIP attribute horizons.
Help.Text:
dabra - ID_YDIP
Identification in HDR_IDENT for the YDIP attribute horizons.

Help.Tip: Whether to edit the average velocity horizons.
Help.Text:
dabra - EDIT_VAV
Whether to edit the average velocity horizons.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES or NO
 
 These horizons will be calculated from the input average velocity horizons
 and the edited BETA horizons.
 
 The output modified average velocity horizons will never contain nil or
 zero values.

Help.Tip: Whether the average velocity horizons are required input.
Help.Text:
dabra - NEED_VAV
Whether the average velocity horizons are required input.

Help.Tip: Identification in HDR_IDENT for the average velocity horizons.
Help.Text:
dabra - ID_VAV
Identification in HDR_IDENT for the average velocity horizons.

Help.Tip: Whether the weights are required input.
Help.Text:
dabra - NEED_WEIGHT
Whether the weights are required input.

Help.Tip: Identification in HDR_IDENT for the weights.
Help.Text:
dabra - ID_WEIGHT
Identification in HDR_IDENT for the weights.

Help.Tip: Whether the horizon time/depths are required input.
Help.Text:
dabra - NEED_DEPTH
Whether the horizon time/depths are required input.

Help.Tip: Identification in HDR_IDENT for the horizon time/depths.
Help.Text:
dabra - ID_DEPTH
Identification in HDR_IDENT for the horizon time/depths.

Help.Tip: Header word containing the X coordinate.
Help.Text:
dabra - HDR_X
Header word containing the X coordinate.
 
 Default = 7
 Allowed = 1 - NWIH

Help.Tip: Header word containing the Y coordinate.
Help.Text:
dabra - HDR_Y
Header word containing the Y coordinate.
 
 Default = 8
 Allowed = 1 - NWIH

Help.Tip: X coordinate of first bin center.
Help.Text:
dabra - X_INIT
X coordinate of first bin center.
 
 Default =  1.0
 Allowed = real (in units of header word HDR_X).

Help.Tip: Y coordinate of first bin center.
Help.Text:
dabra - Y_INIT
Y coordinate of first bin center.
 
 Default =  1.0
 Allowed = real (in units of header word HDR_X).

Help.Tip: Bin increment in X direction.
Help.Text:
dabra - X_INC
Bin increment in X direction.
 
 Default =  1.0
 Allowed = real > 0.0 (in units of header word HDR_X).

Help.Tip: Bin increment in Y direction.
Help.Text:
dabra - Y_INC
Bin increment in Y direction.
 
 Default =  1.0
 Allowed = real > 0.0 (in units of header word HDR_X).

Help.Tip: X coordinate of last bin center. Minimum value of HDR_X.
Help.Text:
dabra - X_LAST
X coordinate of last bin center. Minimum value of HDR_X.
 
 Default =  1.0
 Allowed = real >= X_INIT (in units of header word HDR_X).

Help.Tip: Y coordinate of last bin center.
Help.Text:
dabra - Y_LAST
Y coordinate of last bin center.
 
 Default =  1.0
 Allowed = real >= Y_INIT (in units of header word HDR_X).

Help.Tip: Total number of bins in the X direction.
Help.Text:
dabra - X_TOT
Total number of bins in the X direction.
 
 Default =  1
 Allowed = int > 0.

Help.Tip: Total number of bins in the Y direction.
Help.Text:
dabra - Y_TOT
Total number of bins in the Y direction.
 
 Default =  1
 Allowed = int > 0.

Help.Tip: Number of megabytes of permanent memory required.
Help.Text:
dabra - MBYTES
Number of megabytes of permanent memory required.

Screen.title: Analysis Window Size
Screen.Label: This analysis window is used for anomaly editing and for smoothing.

Help.Tip: Horizon number for specifying NUM_TR_X and NUM_TR_Y.
Help.Text:
dabra - WINSIZE_HORIZNUM
Horizon number for specifying NUM_TR_X and NUM_TR_Y.
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = valid horizon number (1 to NDPT)
 
 This is the horizon number for which the user wishes to specify the following
 parameters which describe the analysis window size:
           NUM_TR_X  (size in the X direction is 2 * NUM_TR_X + 1)
           NUM_TR_Y  (size in the Y direction is 2 * NUM_TR_Y + 1)
 
 The horizon numbers must be specified in ascending order.
 
 Interpolations will be performed between the specified horizons, and flat
 extrapolations will be performed above the first specified horizon and below
 the last specified horizon.

Help.Tip: Number of traces on each side in X dir in analysis window.
Help.Text:
dabra - NUM_TR_X
Number of traces on each side in X dir in analysis window.
 
 Default = 3
 Allowed = integer >= 0
 
 This is the number of traces on each side of the center trace in the
 analysis window.
 
 The analysis window is used to edit and smooth the selected BETA or
 XDIP or YDIP attribute horizons.
 
 The analysis window size is specified with the following two parameters:
           NUM_TR_X  (size in the X direction is 2 * NUM_TR_X + 1)
           NUM_TR_Y  (size in the Y direction is 2 * NUM_TR_Y + 1)

Help.Tip: Number of traces on each side in Y dir in analysis window.
Help.Text:
dabra - NUM_TR_Y
Number of traces on each side in Y dir in analysis window.
 
 Default = 3
 Allowed = integer >= 0
 
 This is the number of traces on each side of the center trace in the
 analysis window.
 
 The analysis window is used to edit and smooth the selected BETA or
 XDIP or YDIP attribute horizons.
 
 The analysis window size is specified with the following two parameters:
           NUM_TR_X  (size in the X direction is 2 * NUM_TR_X + 1)
           NUM_TR_Y  (size in the Y direction is 2 * NUM_TR_Y + 1)

Screen.title: Velocity Constraint Editing
Screen.Label: Apply velocity constraints to the BETA attribute horizons.
BETA values are set to nil if velocity changes fall outside the constraints.
Nil BETA values are optionally replaced after applying constraints.
APPLY_VAV_CONSTRAINTS =
Apply average velocity constraints.
APPLY_VINT_CONSTRAINTS =
Apply interval velocity constraints.
REPLACE_NILS_AFTER_CONSTRAINTS =

Help.Tip: Whether to apply average velocity constraints.
Help.Text:
dabra - APPLY_VAV_CONSTRAINTS
Whether to apply average velocity constraints.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES or NO
 
 This parameter is used to edit the BETA attribute horizons.
 
 The VAV_MIN_PERCENT and VAV_MAX_PERCENT arrays will not be used if this
 parameter is NO.

Help.Tip: Whether to apply interval velocity constraints.
Help.Text:
dabra - APPLY_VINT_CONSTRAINTS
Whether to apply interval velocity constraints.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES or NO
 
 This parameter is used to edit the BETA attribute horizons.
 
 The VINT_MIN_PERCENT and VINT_MAX_PERCENT arrays will not be used if this
 parameter is NO.

Help.Tip: Horizon number for specifying average velocity contraints.
Help.Text:
dabra - VAV_HORIZNUM
Horizon number for specifying average velocity contraints.
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = valid horizon number (1 to NDPT)
 
 This parameter is used to edit the BETA attribute horizons.
 
 This is the horizon number for which the user wishes to specify the following
 parameters:
               VAV_MIN_PERCENT
               VAV_MAX_PERCENT
 
 The horizon numbers must be specified in ascending order.
 
 Interpolations will be performed between the specified horizons, and flat
 extrapolations will be performed above the first specified horizon and below
 the last specified horizon.

Help.Tip: Minimum percentage of average velocity to accept.
Help.Text:
dabra - VAV_MIN_PERCENT
Minimum percentage of average velocity to accept.
 
 Default = 75.0
 Allowed = 0.0 to 100.0
 
 This parameter is used to edit the BETA attribute horizons.
 
 This array is not used if APPLY_VAV_CONSTRAINTS is NO.
 
 Average velocities smaller than the specified threshhold will cause the
 corresponding value in the BETA attribute horizon to be set to nil.

Help.Tip: Maximum percentage of average velocity to accept.
Help.Text:
dabra - VAV_MAX_PERCENT
Maximum percentage of average velocity to accept.
 
 Default = 125.0
 Allowed = 100.0 or greater
 
 This parameter is used to edit the BETA attribute horizons.
 
 This array is not used if APPLY_VAV_CONSTRAINTS is NO.
 
 Average velocities larger than the specified threshhold will cause the
 corresponding value in the BETA attribute horizon to be set to nil.

Help.Tip: Horizon number for specifying interval velocity contraints.
Help.Text:
dabra - VINT_HORIZNUM
Horizon number for specifying interval velocity contraints.
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = valid horizon number (1 to NDPT)
 
 This parameter is used to edit the BETA attribute horizons.
 
 This is the horizon number for which the user wishes to specify the following
 parameters:
               VINT_MIN_PERCENT
               VINT_MAX_PERCENT
 
 The horizon numbers must be specified in ascending order.
 
 Interpolations will be performed between the specified horizons, and flat
 extrapolations will be performed above the first specified horizon and below
 the last specified horizon.

Help.Tip: Minimum percentage of interval velocity to accept.
Help.Text:
dabra - VINT_MIN_PERCENT
Minimum percentage of interval velocity to accept.
 
 Default = 75.0
 Allowed = 0.0 to 100.0
 
 This parameter is used to edit the BETA attribute horizons.
 
 This array is not used if APPLY_VINT_CONSTRAINTS is NO.
 
 Interval velocities smaller than the specified threshhold will cause the
 corresponding value in the BETA attribute horizon to be set to nil.

Help.Tip: Maximum percentage of interval velocity to accept.
Help.Text:
dabra - VINT_MAX_PERCENT
Maximum percentage of interval velocity to accept.
 
 Default = 125.0
 Allowed = 100.0 or greater
 
 This parameter is used to edit the BETA attribute horizons.
 
 This array is not used if APPLY_VINT_CONSTRAINTS is NO.
 
 Interval velocities larger than the specified threshhold will cause the
 corresponding value in the BETA attribute horizon to be set to nil.

Help.Tip: Whether and how to replace nil BETA values after constraints.
Help.Text:
dabra - REPLACE_NILS_AFTER_CONSTRAINTS
Whether and how to replace nil BETA values after constraints.
 
 Default = do not replace nils
 Allowed = use bilinear interpolation
 Allowed = replace nils with zeroes
 Allowed = do not replace nils
 
 This parameter is used after applying velocity constraints to the BETA
 attribute horizons.
 
 Bilinear interpolation simply replaces nils with linearly interpolated values.

Screen.title: Anomaly Editing
Screen.Label: Apply anomaly editing to the BETA or XDIP or YDIP attribute volume.
Attribute values are set to nil if they are anomalous.
REMOVE_BAD_VALUES =
Remove anomalous values based on standard deviation.
USE_WEIGHTED_EDIT =
Use weight volume for standard deviation calculation.
EDITING_PERCENT_VALID =
Percent of analysis window required to contain valid picks.

Help.Tip: Whether to remove anomalous values based on standard deviation.
Help.Text:
dabra - REMOVE_BAD_VALUES
Whether to remove anomalous values based on standard deviation.
 
 Default = YES
 Allowed = YES or NO
 
 This parameter is used to edit the selected BETA or XDIP or YDIP attribute
 volume.
 
 The USE_WEIGHTED_EDIT parameter and the STDEV array will not be used if
 this parameter is NO.

Help.Tip: Whether to use weight volume for standard deviation calculation.
Help.Text:
dabra - USE_WEIGHTED_EDIT
Whether to use weight volume for standard deviation calculation.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES or NO
 
 This parameter is used to edit the selected BETA or XDIP or YDIP attribute
 volume.
 
 Constant weights will be used if this parameter is NO.

Help.Tip: Percent of window required to contain valid picks for editing.
Help.Text:
dabra - EDITING_PERCENT_VALID
Percent of window required to contain valid picks for editing.
 
 Default = 60.0
 Allowed = 0.0 to 100.0
 
 This parameter is used to edit the selected BETA or XDIP or YDIP attribute
 horizons.
 
 The analysis window size is specified with the following two parameters:
           NUM_TR_X  (size in the X direction is 2 * NUM_TR_X + 1)
           NUM_TR_Y  (size in the Y direction is 2 * NUM_TR_Y + 1)

Help.Tip: Horizon number on trace for specifying standard deviation.
Help.Text:
dabra - STDEV_HORIZNUM
Horizon number on trace for specifying standard deviation.
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = valid horizon number (1 to NDPT)
 
 This parameter is used to edit the selected BETA or XDIP or YDIP attribute
 volume.
 
 This is the horizon number for which the user wishes to specify STDEV.
 
 The horizon numbers must be specified in ascending order.
 
 Interpolations will be performed between the specified horizons, and flat
 extrapolations will be performed above the first specified horizon and below
 the last specified horizon.

Help.Tip: Maximum number of standard deviations to allow.
Help.Text:
dabra - STDEV
Maximum number of standard deviations to allow.
 
 Default = 3.0
 Allowed = 0.0 or greater
 
 This parameter is used to edit the selected BETA or XDIP or YDIP attribute
 volume.
 
 Each value in the attribute volume is compared with the mean value
 calculated from an analysis window centered at that value.  A value
 will be set to nil if it differs from the mean value by more than
 the specified number of standard deviations.

Screen.title: Smoothing
Screen.Label: Smooth the BETA or XDIP or YDIP attribute volume after anomaly editing is finish
The anomaly editing will have set some attribute values to nil.
Nil attribute values are optionally replaced before or after smoothing.
Before smoothing:
REPLACE_NILS_BEFORE =
Smoothing:
APPLY_SMOOTHING =
Smooth the edited attribute volume.
USE_WEIGHTED_SMOOTHING =
Use weight volume for smoothing.
USE_DISTANCE_SMOOTHING =
Use inverse distance for smoothing.
USE_TAPERED_SMOOTHING =
Use tapered edges for smoothing.
CENTER_WEIGHT_PERCENT =
Percent of center weight for inverse distance smoothing.
TAPERED_WEIGHT_PERCENT =
Percent of smoothing distance to taper.
SMOOTHING_PERCENT_VALID =
Percent of analysis window required to contain valid picks.
SMOOTHING_TRIM_PERCENT =
Percent of data to trim when smoothing.
After smoothing:
REPLACE_NILS_AFTER =
Additional smoothing of BETA:
SMOOTH_KAPPA_VOLUME =
Smooth the edited and smoothed BETA volume using KAPPA.
VERTICAL_SMOOTHING_DIST =
Vertical smoothing distance in time/depth units.

Help.Tip: Whether and how to replace nil attribute values before smoothing.
Help.Text:
dabra - REPLACE_NILS_BEFORE
Whether and how to replace nil attribute values before smoothing.
 
 Default = do not replace nils
 Allowed = use bilinear interpolation
 Allowed = replace nils with zeroes
 Allowed = do not replace nils
 
 This parameter is used before smoothing the selected BETA or XDIP or
 YDIP attribute horizons.
 
 Bilinear interpolation simply replaces nils with linearly interpolated values.

Help.Tip: Whether to smooth the BETA or XDIP or YDIP attribute horizons.
Help.Text:
dabra - APPLY_SMOOTHING
Whether to smooth the BETA or XDIP or YDIP attribute horizons.
 
 Default = YES
 Allowed = YES or NO
 
 The attribute horizons will be smoothed over the specified analysis window.

Help.Tip: Whether to use the weight volume for smoothing.
Help.Text:
dabra - USE_WEIGHTED_SMOOTHING
Whether to use the weight volume for smoothing.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES or NO
 
 This parameter is used to smooth the selected BETA or XDIP or YDIP attribute
 volume.
 
 SMOOTHING_TRIM_PERCENT must be set to zero in order to use this option.

Help.Tip: Whether to use inverse distance for smoothing.
Help.Text:
dabra - USE_DISTANCE_SMOOTHING
Whether to use inverse distance for smoothing.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES or NO
 
 This parameter is used to smooth the selected BETA or XDIP or YDIP attribute
 volume.
 
 NO causes a stronger smoothing by weighting all traces the same, regardless
 of their distances from the middle trace.
 
 SMOOTHING_TRIM_PERCENT must be set to zero in order to use this option.

Help.Tip: Whether to use a taper at the edge of the smoothing area.
Help.Text:
dabra - USE_TAPERED_SMOOTHING
Whether to use a taper at the edge of the smoothing area.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES or NO
 
 This parameter is used to smooth the selected BETA or XDIP or YDIP attribute
 volume.
 
 NO causes a stronger smoothing by weighting all traces the same, regardless
 of their distances from the middle trace.
 
 SMOOTHING_TRIM_PERCENT must be set to zero in order to use this option.

Help.Tip: Percent of center weight to use for inverse distance smoothing.
Help.Text:
dabra - CENTER_WEIGHT_PERCENT
Percent of center weight to use for inverse distance smoothing.
 
 Default = 20.0
 Allowed = 0.0 to 100.0
 
 This parameter is used to set the weight of the center trace when inverse
 distance weights are used for smoothing.  If this parameter were not used,
 the center trace would always get 100% of the weight because the inverse
 distance would be infinite.
 
 A smaller percent weights the center trace less, causing a stronger smoothing.
 A larger percent weights the center trace more, causing a weaker smoothing.
 
 This parameter is not used if USE_DISTANCE_SMOOTHING is NO.

Help.Tip: Percent of the distance to taper for tapered smoothing.
Help.Text:
dabra - TAPERED_WEIGHT_PERCENT
Percent of the distance to taper for tapered smoothing.
 
 Default = 20.0
 Allowed = 0.0 to 100.0
 
 This parameter is used to set the size of the tapered area at the edge of
 the smoothing area.  for example, if this parameter is set to 20, the
 outer 20% of the smoothing distance will be tapered (lower weights grading
 to zero) and the inner 80% will have constant weights.
 
 A smaller percent produces a narrower taper, causing a stronger smoothing.
 A larger percent produces a wider taper, causing a weaker smoothing.
 
 This parameter is not used if USE_TAPERED_SMOOTHING is NO.

Help.Tip: Percent of window required to contain valid picks for smoothing.
Help.Text:
dabra - SMOOTHING_PERCENT_VALID
Percent of window required to contain valid picks for smoothing.
 
 Default = 60.0
 Allowed = 0.0 to 100.0
 
 This parameter is used to smooth the selected BETA or XDIP or YDIP attribute
 horizons.
 
 The analysis window size is specified with the following two parameters:
           NUM_TR_X  (size in the X direction is 2 * NUM_TR_X + 1)
           NUM_TR_Y  (size in the Y direction is 2 * NUM_TR_Y + 1)

Help.Tip: Percent of data in window to trim when smoothing.
Help.Text:
dabra - SMOOTHING_TRIM_PERCENT
Percent of data in window to trim when smoothing.
 
 Default = 0.0
 Allowed = 0.0 to 100.0
 
 This parameter is used to smooth the selected BETA or XDIP or YDIP attribute
 horizons.
 
 This parameter specifies how much of the data in the analysis window
 should be trimmed while smoothing.
 
 The value 0.0 causes a mean value to be calculated (no trimming).
 The value 100.0 causes a median value to be calculated (100% trimming).
 
 Only the non-nil values are used to calculate the trimmed mean.
 If SMOOTHING_TRIM_PERCENT is greater than zero, USE_WEIGHTED_SMOOTHING,
 USE_DISTANCE_SMOOTHING and USE_TAPERED_SMOOTHING are not used (i.e. all
 data points have the same weight).
 
 The analysis window size is specified with the following two parameters:
           NUM_TR_X  (size in the X direction is 2 * NUM_TR_X + 1)
           NUM_TR_Y  (size in the Y direction is 2 * NUM_TR_Y + 1)

Help.Tip: Whether and how to replace nil attribute values after smoothing.
Help.Text:
dabra - REPLACE_NILS_AFTER
Whether and how to replace nil attribute values after smoothing.
 
 Default = do not replace nils
 Allowed = use bilinear interpolation
 Allowed = replace nils with zeroes
 Allowed = do not replace nils
 Allowed = reset interpolated values back to nil
 
 This parameter is used after smoothing the selected BETA or XDIP or
 YDIP attribute horizons.
 
 Bilinear interpolation simply replaces nils with linearly interpolated values.
 
 Resetting interpolated values to nil after smoothing will replace smoothed
 values with nil for those values which were originally nil before the
 REPLACE_NILS_BEFORE action was taken.

Help.Tip: Whether to smooth the BETA volume using KAPPA.
Help.Text:
dabra - SMOOTH_KAPPA_VOLUME
Whether to smooth the BETA volume using KAPPA.
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed = YES or NO
 
 This parameter is used to smooth the BETA volume using KAPPA.
 The KAPPA horizons will be smoothed laterally over the specified analysis
 window, and then the KAPPA traces will be smoothed vertically using the
 VERTICAL_SMOOTHING_DIST parameter.
 
 This is an additional action which is performed after the BETA volume
 has been edited and smoothed in the normal manner.
 
 KAPPA = input interval velocity / output interval velocity.
 GAMMA = input average velocity / output average velocity.
 GAMMA = sqrt(BETA + 1)
 BETA  = GAMMA**2 - 1
 
 These steps are performed:
  (1) Any nils in the BETA volume are interpolated.
  (2) The BETA volume is converted to a GAMMA volume.
  (3) The GAMMA volume is converted to a KAPPA volume.
  (4) Any nils originally in the BETA volume are restored in the KAPPA volume.
  (5) The KAPPA volume is smoothed laterally.
  (6) Any nils in the smoothed KAPPA volume are interpolated.
  (7) The KAPPA volume is smoothed vertically.
  (8) The smoothed KAPPA volume is converted to a GAMMA volume.
  (9) The GAMMA volume is converted to a BETA volume.
 (10) Any nils originally in the BETA volume are restored.

Help.Tip: Vertical smoothing distance for KAPPA in time/depth units.
Help.Text:
dabra - VERTICAL_SMOOTHING_DIST
Vertical smoothing distance for KAPPA in time/depth units.
 
 Default = 0.0
 Allowed = real >= 0.0
 
 This parameter is used with the SMOOTH_KAPPA_VOLUME parameter.
 No vertical smoothing is performed if this parameter is zero.

Help.Tip: Button that removes this process parameter screen.
Help.Text:
dabra - CLOSE
Button that removes this process parameter screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Appears only on the view-only process parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
Help.Text:
dabra - OK
Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values, runs the parameter traps and removes
 the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
Help.Text:
dabra - APPLY
Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps but does
 not remove the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
Help.Text:
dabra - CANCEL
Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =

Help.Tip: Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
Help.Text:
dabra - RESET
Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that sets the parameters back to their values when the screen appeared
 or to their last applied value.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
Help.Text:
dabra - PROCESSLISTLEFT
Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the previous process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
Help.Text:
dabra - PROCESSLIST
Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Menu that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to any chosen process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
Help.Text:
dabra - PROCESSLISTRIGHT
Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the next process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
Help.Text:
dabra - PROJECTDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as Project Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of Project Defaults for a project.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
Help.Text:
dabra - USERDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as User Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of User Defaults for a userid.

Help.Tip: Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
Help.Text:
dabra - HELP
Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 The Help Window allows access to three kinds of help:  Parameter Help, CPS
 Process Help and Application (CFE) Help.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                         C P S   P R O C E S S
 
 Name       : DABRA              (analyse Dip and ABRA horizon slices)
 Category   : migrations
 Written    : 2003-06-19   by: Tom Stoeckley
 Revised    : 2005-01-31   by: Tom Stoeckley
 Maturity   : production
 Purpose    : Analyze and edit a combo of input horizon slices for tomography.
 Portability: No known limitations, but see note below.
 Parallel   : No.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                          GENERAL DESCRIPTION
 
 This process prepares data for tomography by analyzing and editing a
 combination of horizon-sliced 3D data input volumes which are in trace format.
 Each horizon corresponds to one sample point in all the traces.
 
 Possible input and output traces at each CMP are the following:
 
      91  The weights                                      (calculated by KA).
      85  The output average velocity                          (edited by KA).
     181  The residual NMO velocity ratio       (BETA attribute edited by KA).
     188  The structural dip in the X direction (XDIP attribute edited by KA).
     189  The structural dip in the Y direction (YDIP attribute edited by KA).
       1  The time or depth of the horizon                (created by SLICER).
 
    Header word HDR_IDENT identifies the type of information each trace
    contains.  These header word values are listed above.
 
    Not all input traces are required; only those which are needed to
    prepare the requested output traces are needed.  The GUI lists the
    required input traces dynamically depending on the current state
    of the process parameters.
 
 This process performs the following steps in the indicated order:
 
    (1) Removes anomalous values from the ATTRIBUTE horizons.
    (2) Optionally replaces nil values in the ATTRIBUTE horizons.
    (3) Smooths the ATTRIBUTE horizons.
    (4) Optionally replaces nil values in the ATTRIBUTE horizons.
  If the ATTRIBUTE horizons are BETA, also performs the following steps:
    (5) Edits the input average velocities using the edited BETA horizons.
    (6) Applies velocity constraints to the edited BETA horizons.
    (7) Optionally replaces nil values in the new edited BETA horizons.
    (8) Edits input average velocities again using new edited BETA horizons.
    (9) Always replaces nil values in the new edited average velocity horizons.
 
 Notes regarding the above steps:
 
    Anomalies:   Values in the ATTRIBUTE horizons are set to nil where they
      (1)        differ from the mean in the surrounding data window by
                 more than the specified standard deviations.
 
    Smoothing:   Values in the ATTRIBUTE horizons are reset to the mean of all
      (3)        non-nil values in the surrounding data window.
 
    Constraints: Values in the edited BETA horizons are set to nil where the
      (6)        differences between the input and edited average or inteval
                 velocities are outside of the specified constraints.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                          ADVICE FOR USERS
 
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                             REVISION HISTORY
 
     Date        Author     Description
     ----        ------     -----------
  7. 2005-01-31  Stoeckley  Add SMOOTH_KAPPA_VOLUME, VERTICAL_SMOOTHING_DIST,
                             USE_TAPERED_SMOOTHING, and TAPERED_WEIGHT_PERCENT.
  6. 2003-10-23  Stoeckley  Add REPLACE_NILS_AFTER_CONSTRAINTS and
                             SMOOTHING_TRIM_PERCENT; add an option
                             to REPLACE_NILS_AFTER.
  5. 2003-10-02  Stoeckley  Add nullify calls before the memman_nullify calls
                             to satisfy Portland Group compiler.
  4. 2003-09-29  Stoeckley  Fix GAMMA = sqrt(BETA+1) which was upside down;
                             fix bug with the application of interval velocity
                             contraints for the top horizon.
  3. 2003-08-22  Stoeckley  Fix calculation of standard deviation; remove
                             requirement that VAV must always be input when
                             BETA is edited; add parameter HORIZON_UNIT.
  2. 2003-07-30  Stoeckley  Remove special treatment of input depth horizon.
  1. 2003-06-19  Stoeckley  Initial version.
